intro: Pouzolzia wightii var. scabra, commonly known as the rough pouzolzia, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in dry environments.
